item.title: Engie 首席执行官称法国面临退出欧盟电力市场的停电风险
item.description: 法国电力公司（Engie SA）首席执行官表示，如果退出欧盟单一能源市场，法国将面临电价上涨甚至停电的风险。【原文：France would risk higher power prices and even blackouts if it were to exit the European Union’s single energy market, said the chief executive officer of the utility Engie SA.】

item.title: 英国下任首相面临大选后经济困境加剧的问题
item.description: 随着选民感受到失业率上升带来的压力，英国下届政府在上任后的头几个月将面临经济痛苦水平的新一轮上升。【原文：The UK’s next government will confront a fresh increase in economic misery levels in its first months in office as voters feel the pinch from rising unemployment.】

item.title: 阿迪达斯首席执行官借桑巴热潮重振叶氏失败后的品牌
item.description: 无论德国队在未来三周的 2024 年欧洲杯上表现如何，东道主德国足球队及其最知名品牌之一的时代都将结束：德国队将穿着阿迪达斯队服进行最后一场欧洲杯比赛。【原文：No matter how Germany fares during Euro 2024 over the coming three weeks, an era of sorts will end for the host country’s football team and one of its best-known brands: Die Mannschaft will play its last European championship tournament match in Adidas uniforms.】

item.title: 股票交易者驾驭法国大选动荡指南
item.description: 法国权力制衡发生变化的前景令投资者惶恐不安，银行、高速公路运营商和公用事业公司等股票的走势最为岌岌可危。【原文：The prospect of a change in the balance of power in France has investors on edge, with banks, highway operators and utilities among the stocks with most on the line.】

item.title: 富裕的拉美人和游客吸引了对马德里酒店的投资
item.description: 罗伯特-德尼罗（Robert De Niro）与他人共同创立的 Nobu Hospitality LLC 集团正在将马德里市中心的一栋办公楼改造成豪华酒店，而就在这栋办公楼的隔壁，一座标志性建筑本周被墨西哥投资者杰罗尼莫-布雷默（Jeronimo Bremer）的公司抢购，并有可能将其改造成五星级酒店。【原文：Just doors down from where the Robert De Niro co-founded group Nobu Hospitality LLC is transforming a central Madrid office building into a luxury hotel, an iconic edifice was snapped up this week by Mexican investor Jeronimo Bremer’s firm, potentially to turn it into a five-star lodge.】

item.title: 全球投资者对曾经最爱的日本股票转趋谨慎
item.description: 随着外国投资者在经济不景气的情况下抛售股票，日本股市今年早些时候创纪录的涨势正在成为遥远的记忆。【原文：Japan’s record share market rally earlier this year is looking like a distant memory as foreign investors sell off stocks in a sluggish economy.】

item.title: 日本散户投资者关注日元干预的风险赌注
item.description: 随着日元汇率的下滑，日本再次干预市场的可能性增大，散户交易员似乎正在重新押注日元反弹。【原文：An army of retail traders appears to be reloading bets for a rebound in the yen as the currency’s slide increases the chances of Japan intervening in the market again.】

item.title: 美联储的关键通胀指标可能为降息提供路径：生态周报
item.description: 美联储青睐的通胀指标将显示出自去年年底以来最微弱的月度增长；这是官员们开始降息的垫脚石，最快可能在 9 月份降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s favored inflation yardsticks are poised to show the tamest monthly advances since late last year — a stepping stone for officials to begin lowering interest rates, possibly as soon as September.】

item.title: 信贷强劲增长今年首次遭遇挫折
item.description: 全球公司债券利差有望出现自去年年底以来的首次月度疲软，这再次引发了关于 2024 年下半年信贷相对于其他固定收益类别的相对价值的争论。【原文：Global corporate bond spreads are on track to turn in their first month of weakening since late last year, reigniting the debate about the relative value of credit versus other fixed-income classes heading into the second half of 2024.】

item.title: 中国和欧盟同意就电动汽车关税问题举行会谈
item.description: 中国和欧盟同意就该集团对从亚洲国家进口的电动汽车征收关税的计划展开会谈。【原文：China and the European Union agreed to start talks on the bloc’s plans to impose tariffs on electric vehicles imports from the Asian nation.】

item.title: 哈贝克敦促中国停止规避欧盟对俄罗斯的制裁
item.description: 德国副总理罗伯特-哈贝克（Robert Habeck）呼吁中国停止向俄罗斯出口可能用于乌克兰战争的欧洲商品。【原文：German Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck called on China to stop diverting exports of European goods to Russia that could be used in the war on Ukraine.】

item.title: 哈伯德说 "普通人可能有想法
item.description:
通胀在下降，"但我买的东西价格仍然较高"

Inflation is coming down, ‘but the prices of things I'm buying are still higher’

】

item.title: 暴跌近百万桶后，巴西成为石油市场的通病
item.description: 巴西石油产量从惊人的崩溃中反弹，有望使欧佩克微观管理全球供应和价格的努力复杂化。【原文：Brazil’s rebound from a stunning collapse in oil production promises to complicate OPEC efforts to micromanage global supplies and prices.】

item.title: 马克龙求助对手联盟，阻止 "极端分子 "掌权
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）表示，对立的政治团体可以共同执政，以阻止 "极端分子 "的执政之路，因为民意调查显示，他的中间派政党及其盟友将在大选中失败。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron said opposing political groups could govern together to block the path to power of the “extremes,” as polls indicate his centrist party and its allies are set for an election defeat.】

item.title: 瑞士在银行业崩溃后推动金融系统重构
item.description: 去年年初，当瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）濒临破产之际，一批瑞士银行家、技术专家和地区官员已经开始忙于为新型金融基础设施奠定基础。【原文：As Credit Suisse spiraled toward insolvency early last year, a group of Swiss bankers, technocrats and regional officials were already busy laying the groundwork for a new type of financial infrastructure.】

item.title: 水务公司 Sabesp 启动价值 30 亿美元的巴西股票出售活动
item.description: 拉丁美洲市值最大的水务公司 Sabesp 启动了一次股票发行，这可能成为该地区两年来最大的一次股票发行。【原文：Sabesp, Latin America’s biggest water utility by market value, launched a share offering that may become the region’s largest in two years.】

item.title: 中国财报之痛削弱股市反弹乐观情绪
item.description: 随着期待已久的盈利复苏未能实现，中国股市的投资者正在失去耐心，反弹势头也随之瓦解。【原文：Investors in Chinese stocks are losing patience as a long-awaited earnings recovery fails to come through and a rally unravels.】

item.title: Equity 集团支持的 Ardent Health 公司二度申请 IPO
item.description: 大股东为 Equity Group Investments 的医院运营商 Ardent Health Partners Inc.【原文：Hospital operator Ardent Health Partners Inc., whose majority owner is Equity Group Investments, has filed again for an initial public offering.】

item.title: CDK 黑客索要数百万赎金以结束汽车经销商业务中断
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士称，一个声称已入侵北美数千家汽车经销商的软件供应商 CDK Global 的组织已索要数千万美元的赎金。【原文：A group that claims to have hacked CDK Global, the software provider to thousands of car dealerships in North America, has demanded tens of millions of dollars in ransom, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 香菜价格暴涨 400% 迫使墨西哥烤肉店发挥创意
item.description: 干旱导致香菜价格飙升，迫使烤肉店重新考虑他们的菜肴，也迫使市场放弃这种香草。【原文：Soaring cilantro prices caused by a droughts are forcing taquerias to rethink their dishes and markets to ditch the herb.】

item.title: 华尔街 "智能交易大军 "再遭股灾重创
item.description: 作为一家产品制造商，华尔街的发展势头迅猛。【原文：As a product manufacturer, Wall Street is on a roll.】

item.title: AMC 开始与贷款人谈判削减债务、延长期限
item.description: 据知情人士透露，AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. 正在与其部分贷款方就降低债务负担和延长近期到期期限进行秘密会谈。【原文：AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. is holding confidential talks with some of its lenders about lowering its debt load and extending near-term maturities, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 由 Desmarais 支持的抵押贷款公司 Nesto 收购贷款机构 CMLS
item.description: 由蒙特利尔 Desmarais 家族支持的加拿大在线抵押贷款公司 Nesto Inc.【原文：Nesto Inc., a Canadian online mortgage company backed by Montreal’s Desmarais family, struck a deal to acquire real estate financier CMLS Group, vaulting it to more than C$60 billion ($43.8 billion) in mortgages under administration.】

item.title: 科技基金创纪录的现金注入源于 "混乱 "的再平衡
item.description: 从表面上看，以技术为重点的股票基金刚刚享受了一周创纪录的资金流入，这是人工智能热潮的最新迹象。然而，对其内部结构的分析表明，几乎所有资金都流入了一只基金，而且与该行业的基本面关系不大。【原文：On the surface, technology-focused stock funds just enjoyed a week of record inflows, the latest sign of the AI craze. A look under the hood, however, showed almost all the money went into a single fund — and it had little to do with the industry’s fundamentals.】

item.title: ETF IQ：共同基金经理可以大胆说 "不
item.description: 欢迎收看 ETF IQ，这是一份专门报道 12 万亿美元全球 ETF 行业的周报。我是彭博新闻社记者兼主播凯蒂-格雷菲尔德（Katie Greifeld）。【原文：Welcome to ETF IQ, a weekly newsletter dedicated to the $12 trillion global ETF industry. I'm Bloomberg News reporter and anchor Katie Greifeld.】

item.title: 天奇抨击智利监管机构，权衡 SQM 交易中的法律选择
item.description: 智利证券监管机构拒绝了中国天齐锂业公司寻求股东批准一项交易的请求，该交易将使一家国有企业控制一家规模庞大的锂矿运营公司，在此之后，天齐锂业公司正在权衡各种法律选择。【原文：Tianqi Lithium Corp. is weighing legal options after Chile’s securities regulator snubbed the Chinese firm’s request to seek shareholder approval for a deal that would see a state-owned company take control of a sprawling lithium operation.】

item.title: 密苏里州回绝 NFL 酋长队后，堪萨斯州急于吸引 NFL 酋长队
item.description: 堪萨斯州州长劳拉-凯利（Laura Kelly）签署了一项法案，旨在吸引全国橄榄球联盟的堪萨斯城酋长队（Kansas City Chiefs）或美国职业棒球大联盟的堪萨斯城皇家队（Kansas City Royals）从密苏里州跨州搬迁。【原文：Kansas Governor Laura Kelly signed a bill intended to entice the National Football League’s Kansas City Chiefs or Major League Baseball’s Kansas City Royals to move across state lines from Missouri.】

item.title: 奇货通讯：这对美联储来说很棘手
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看每周一期的《奇货》时事通讯，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣的发展的看法。特蕾西本周五去远足了，所以只有乔。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy. Tracy is away on a hiking trip this Friday, so it’s just Joe.】

item.title: 日元暴跌，美元连胜延续至第五周
item.description: 由于美联储首次降息的时机仍不明朗，衡量美元强弱的一个关键指标将连胜势头延续到第五周。【原文：A key gauge of dollar strength is extending its winning streak into a fifth week as the timing for the Federal Reserve’s first interest rate cut remains cloudy.】

item.title: 基金回补看跌押注，钯金飙升至一个月高点
item.description: 钯金飙升至一个月以来的最高点，原因是汽车制造商的补货活动导致交易商买回看跌押注。【原文：Palladium surged to the highest in a month as traders bought back their bearish bets amid restocking activity by automakers.】
